meta.title: As Americans, what do we owe each other?

hero.text: As Americans, what do we owe each other?

slidesScroll.text: Our country is increasingly polarized.
As we approach America’s 250th anniversary, it is important to remember the principles that bind us together.
We asked 5,000 Americans from all 50 states: what are the responsibilities of being an American?

slidesFixed.text: What percent of Americans do you think view “defending freedom” as a civic responsibility? ● Drag the dot to your guess. Continue scrolling to submit.
You said {userResponse}%. The correct answer is 87%.
91% of Americans see “following the Constitution” as a civic responsibility.
About a third see “donating to charity” as a civic responsibility.
Democrats and Republicans agree about many things…
Younger and older Americans also differ.
Yet despite these differences, Americans agree on one thing…
